params.taskDescription:
If you draw 3 cards without replacement, what is the probability that you draw a <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
    <mo>♡</mo>
  </mrow>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">♡</annotation></semantics></math>, a <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
    <mo>♣</mo>
  </mrow>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">♣</annotation></semantics></math>, and a <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
    <mo>♡</mo>
  </mrow>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">♡</annotation></semantics></math>, in order?

params.taskDescription:
If you draw 3 cards without replacement, what is the probability that you draw 2 <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
    <mo>♡</mo>
  </mrow>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">♡</annotation></semantics></math> and 1 <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
    <mo>♣</mo>
  </mrow>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">♣</annotation></semantics></math>, in any order?

questionSetStimulus:
In the following exercises, you’re drawing cards from a special deck of cards containing <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mn>2</mn>
  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
    <mo>♡</mo>
  </mrow>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">2♡</annotation></semantics></math>, <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mn>2</mn>
  <mi mathvariant="normal">♣<!-- ♣ --></mi>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">2\clubsuit</annotation></semantics></math>, <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mn>2</mn>
  <mi mathvariant="normal">♢<!-- ♢ --></mi>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">2\diamondsuit</annotation></semantics></math>, <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mn>2</mn>
  <mi mathvariant="normal">♠<!-- ♠ --></mi>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">2\spadesuit</annotation></semantics></math>, <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mn>3</mn>
  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
    <mo>♡</mo>
  </mrow>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">3♡</annotation></semantics></math>, <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mn>3</mn>
  <mi mathvariant="normal">♣<!-- ♣ --></mi>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">3\clubsuit</annotation></semantics></math>, <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mn>3</mn>
  <mi mathvariant="normal">♠<!-- ♠ --></mi>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">3\spadesuit</annotation></semantics></math>, <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mn>4</mn>
  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
    <mo>♡</mo>
  </mrow>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">4♡</annotation></semantics></math>, <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mn>4</mn>
  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
    <mo>♣</mo>
  </mrow>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">4♣</annotation></semantics></math>, <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mn>5</mn>
  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
    <mo>♡</mo>
  </mrow>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">5♡</annotation></semantics></math>.
